title: Need help building a local tool that produces Jupiter V6 swap instructions

detail.description:
I currently run a program that uses Jupiter V6 Swap API to execute token swaps on the Solana blockchain. The program works by first fetching a quote for the given parameters (input token, output token, amount, etc.), and it fetches this quote by calling the Jupiter /quote endpoint, which returns data in the form of an object called quoteResponse. Once a quote is fetched, the program then builds a transaction that it will submit to the blockchain (specifically submitting transactions to the Jito network currently). When building the transaction, the program further utilizes Jupiter by calling the /swap-instructions endpoint offered by Jupiter. The /swap-instructions endpoint accepts quoteResponse as input and generates a complete and ordered list of instructions that the program simply inserts into the transaction. 

However, the process of calling the /swap-instruction endpoint is responsible for over half of the latency produced by my program between fetching the quote and submitting the transaction to Jito. **I am trying to reduce this latency by creating a local tool that will run on my own machine that will mimic the function of the /swap-instruction endpoint but without the latency inherent with external RPC/API calls.** There is a lengthy amount of information that the tool would need to produce effective output. Most of this information can be retrieved from the quoteResponse or in other areas of the overall program, such as:

- Automated Market Maker key: public key of relevant AMMs
- Input Mint: Address of the origin token that I will be swapping out from
- Output Mint: Address of the destination token that I will be swapping to
- Input Amount: Amount of the origin token that I will be exchanging in the transaction
- Output Amount: Amount of the destination token that I will be receiving in the transaction
- Fee Amount: Amount of fees to be paid in the transaction (fees always paid in SOL)
- DEX Label: Name of the DEX program ID involved in the transaction (examples are "Raydium Concentrated Liquidity" or "Meteora DLMM Program"
- Slippage: The maximum change in token price (expressed as percentage in format "0.05" or "0.1" etc.) that the program is willing to except to still proceed with the transaction by the time it's submitted to Jito
- Swap Mode: Parameter specific to Jupiter, by default i always choose "ExactIn" which means the program expects you to specify the exact amount of input token for the swap, then it will determine the output token amount after accounting for currency conversion and slippage and fees. Other option would be "ExactOut" where you specify the exact amount of output token you want from the transaction, and it will conversely determine all other parameters needed to satisfy that requirement
- otherAmountThreshold: Parameter specific to Jupiter and I believe is paired with the Swap Mode Parameter, as this simply represents the minimum amount of the output token that you're willing to accept in the transaction, so another way of representing slippage, just as an exact number this time instead of a percentage as noted in the Swap Mode parameter
- Input Token Decimals: Amount of decimals used in the formatting of the origin token
- Output Token Decimals: Amount of decimals used in the formatting of the destination token



Aside from the information mentioned, there is also required information that can only be gathered through external RPC/API calls. For this, I would like a caching mechanism to store these parameters as they map to the other information in the tool, so that over time it will gradually eliminate the need for external RPC/API calls and can reference everything locally. The program implements this caching methodology for Address Lookup Tables currently, which has resulted in phenomenal latency improvements.
detail.deliverables:
1. Data Model Classes

2. Config/Constants Files: For program IDs and other known static data.

3. Functions to query user ATAs (Associated Token Address) and confirm existence.

4. Reliable ATA creation function (prepare instruction, sign, send, and verify successful creation).

5. Borsh schema definitions for Raydium, Meteora, and Orca instruction formats.

6. Serialization function that returns the serialized instruction data buffer.

7. Utility functions to compute slippage-based thresholds.

8. Updated serialization calls that include correct amount_in, minimum_amount_out, or amount_out fields, fully precision-adjusted.

9. A function that returns a fully constructed Transaction object ready to be signed and sent.

title: Building a MVP of a problem solving site that uses a library of consulting frameworks

detail.description:
https://preview--problem-pairing-pal.lovable.app

I am building a MVP of a site called Probspec that helps users to specify their problems and then matches their problem statements to known problem solving frameworks from a database and attempts to apply those frameworks to satisfy the user. 

The way the system works from user perspective is:
1. The user opens the website at probspec.com and sees a classic homepage
2. The user then clicks the “Get Started” button and navigates to a form where they answer questions and eventually specify their problem in text. 
3. An LLM may ask follow-up questions.
4. At some point, some kind of database matching is triggered and the system suggests relevant problem-solving frameworks from the framework database (explained via LLM)
5. The user chooses a relevant framework or specifies what they want. 
6. The system walks through an analysis, laying out a plan step by step and searching the web and/or using integrations to fill in data. For the MVP, this does not have to be fully baked. An LLM merely describing the relevant framework(s) and saying how it would proceed is more than enough for now.
7. The system prepares a PDF or other type of summary. Again, for the demo this can be very minimal / proof-of-concept. 
8. The user can choose to keep requesting changes or do further analysis, creating some kind of internal memory or account. 

I have a wireframe UI and GitHub repo that I made using Lovable. I am enjoying using the service Lovable, which seems to have good integration with supabase for database back-end.

Here is my plan for a ~7-day project:

* Day 1: Spend a ~day of paid time just to get up to speed on the task, have an intro phone call
* Day 2-3: Break down the project into definable sub-tasks and define an end goal. Get the core Github repo in clean shape for working and integrating all the different pieces
* Day 4-7: Integrate LLM system with user interface and back-end database
* Day 7-10: Testing and troubleshooting to get to MVP

I am free daily for a 45 minute meeting anytime between 8am and 10 am US Pacific time.

title: Develop a cross-platform mobile app using React Native to streamline home insurance quote submission and management with real-time API integration and an intuitive user interface.

detail.description:
I need an experienced React Native developer to build a cross-platform mobile app for submitting and managing home insurance quotes. The app will integrate with a third-party API to fetch real-time quotes and include features like user authentication, a dashboard for quote tracking, and push notifications. The final product should be scalable, secure, and optimized for iOS and Android.


---

Key Features:

1. User Authentication: Secure login, sign-up, and password recovery.


2. Quote Submission: A form to collect client/home information.


3. API Integration: Connect with a Home Insurance Quoting API for real-time quote retrieval.


4. Quote Management Dashboard: Display and track submitted quotes with status updates.


5. Push Notifications: Notify users of quote status changes or promotions.


6. Scalable Backend: Ensure secure storage of user data and smooth app performance.


7. Responsive Design: Optimize the app for both iOS and Android devices 

What I’m Looking For:

Links to your GitHub, portfolio, or apps showing relevant experience.

A ballpark estimate for the total cost of the project.
detail.deliverables:
A fully functional mobile app built with React Native.

Backend setup with secure database integration.

Integration with the Home Insurance Quoting API.

Final deployment to the App Store and Google Play.

Post-launch support for bug fixes.

title: Full-stack Developer for Decentralized Gaming DApp

detail.description:
We are building an innovative decentralized application (DApp) that revolutionizes the way gamers purchase and own video games across different platforms and game stores. By leveraging NFTs (Non-Fungible Tokens), our platform provides users with a seamless, cross-platform gaming experience. Users will be able to purchase games and claim ownership through NFTs, which serve as proof of ownership that can be accessed and used across a variety of gaming platforms.

Our progress has been temporarily halted due to unforeseen circumstances, but we are back on track and are looking for a talented Full-stack Developer to join our team and help us bring this exciting project to life.

What You’ll Be Doing:

- Develop the Front-End: Build and maintain the user-facing side of the DApp using modern front-end technologies.
- UI/UX Overhaul: Collaborate closely with designers and stakeholders to improve the current user interface and experience, ensuring a smooth and intuitive platform for users of all backgrounds.
- Integrate Blockchain Functionality: Work with blockchain and smart contract teams to ensure that the front-end interacts seamlessly with the underlying decentralized backend (e.g., NFT transactions, wallet integrations, etc.).
- Cross-Platform Compatibility: Ensure the DApp works flawlessly across various devices (desktop, tablet, mobile) and integrates with multiple gaming platforms and stores.
- Optimize for Performance: Ensure the application is optimized for speed, scalability, and responsiveness.
- Collaborate in an Agile Environment: Work closely with a multidisciplinary team of developers, designers, and product managers to refine the product vision and bring it to life.

title: "Develop a secure, cloud-integrated platform to create a reliable stem cell donor database for emergencies and personalized healthcare."

detail.description:
Seeking collaborators to create a secure, cloud-integrated platform for a reliable stem cell donor database to improve emergency and personalized healthcare."
We’re working on a platform called Navisutra, which aims to solve the critical gap in stem cell availability during medical emergencies. Our vision is to develop a secure, scalable donor database with features like:

Cloud integration for real-time accessibility.
Advanced security measures to protect sensitive donor information.
A user-friendly interface for managing donor profiles and healthcare provider access.
This is a high-impact project with significant societal benefits, and we’re looking for:

Backend developers skilled in Python or Node.js.
Cloud experts for AWS/GCP integration.
Security specialists for database protection.
If you’re passionate about healthcare innovation, let’s collaborate!
Contact: bairavaash@protonmail.com

Cloud integration for real-time accessibility.
Advanced security measures to protect sensitive donor information.
A user-friendly interface for managing donor profiles and healthcare provider access.

Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and implement features that enhance user interaction.
Ensure the website is optimized for performance and SEO best practices.
Test and troubleshoot website functionality across various browsers and devices.

report on these in a way that describes the threat, one or more
options for fixing any vulnerabilities, and ways to prevent
introducing similar vulnerabilities in the future. If you have
ideas on how to detect if a vulnerability has been exploited
in the past, that is also appreciated!

But beyond that, I want to continue that momentum in my job to come so I'm executing well from Day One. 

I'd be interested in a longer-term mentorship from someone who deeply knows Rails and has some Application Security background as well.

title: I need to learn Ruby on Rails, and Application Security for Ruby on Rails, as FAST as possible!

detail.description:
I have a take-home Application Security Engineering project for a company that lives in Rails.

Here's a short version of the README for the assignment:

# AppSec Test

This example application is an email sending tool with the following features:

1. Users can add individual recipients to their account
2. Users can select a group of recipients to whom to send a rich
   text email
3. Users may import a CSV of recipients and see conflicting
   names with imported users and existing users

This application is implemented in Ruby on Rails, using
[ActiveAdmin](https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin) and other
stack components very similar to that in our own stack.

We use:

- [ActiveAdmin](https://github.com/activeadmin/activeadmin) to implement most of the structure of the application and its user interface
- [Devise](https://github.com/heartcombo/devise) to implement authentication
- [Pundit](https://github.com/varvet/pundit) to implement authorization
- [ActionText](https://guides.rubyonrails.org/action_text_overview.html) to implement rich text entry for HTML emails
- [React](https://react.dev/) to implement bulk recipient imports
- [Apollo](https://www.apollographql.com/docs/react/) to handle frontend GraphQL communication for bulk recipient imports
- [GraphQL Ruby](https://graphql-ruby.org/) for server side GraphQL implementation


## Using the application

The most important concepts and models in the application are:

1. Users - these includes the admin user above as well as a number
   of non-privileged users who may send emails to Recipients in
   their account.
2. Recipients - these are names and emails associated with a User
   who may receive emails. Recipients are not Users themselves,
   though it's possible a Recipient and User share an email address.
3. Emails - these are emails with subjects, rich text body contents,
   and an associated list of Recipients to whom the emails are sent.
   (The application doesn't actually send any real emails.)

The application is setup with seed data of a number of users, each
with their own recipients.

You may login as any of the users by finding their email address on
the Users dashboard and the password `password_1234`.

## Exercise

Your task is to review the application for any security issues and
report on these in a way that describes the threat, one or more
options for fixing any vulnerabilities, and ways to prevent
introducing similar vulnerabilities in the future. If you have
ideas on how to detect if a vulnerability has been exploited
in the past, that is also appreciated!

You **do not** need to provide automated exploits or complex fixes
beyond a few example lines of code.

For any areas you investigate and do not find security issues,
please also note what potential issues you were looking for and
why you believe the code you looked at may not be vulnerable.

title: Create a new website for wpoptic.com a free chrome extension detecting WordPress plugins

detail.description:
WPoptic.com is a free chrome extension that detects WordPress plugins active on a website. Right now the site is quite simple as we are still improving our extension. For the new site we will need a new homepage including packages that we are going to sell. Please check out the website, and also check out the extension because we will keep the style of the extension. It’s important for the job that you have a good understanding of the Chrome extension. Show us your best design and hopefully we can work things out.

Summary

As a Web Developer for wpoptic.com, you will be instrumental in creating an innovative website for a free Chrome extension that detects WordPress plugins. Reporting to the project manager, you will leverage your core skills in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and front-end development to build a user-friendly interface. Your premium skills in Docker and SQL will enhance the website's functionality and performance. Additionally, your relevant experience in web design and SEO will ensure the site is optimized for user engagement and search visibility, making a significant impact on our audience.
detail.deliverables:
Qualifications

Proficient in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS for front-end development
Experience with WordPress and creating user-friendly websites
Familiarity with Docker and SQL databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL)
Knowledge of web design principles and SEO best practices
Ability to wireframe and design intuitive user interfaces
Understanding of RESTful services and e-commerce platforms
Level of expertise Advanced

Responsibilities

Design and develop a user-friendly website for wpoptic.com, focusing on the detection of WordPress plugins.
Utilize core technologies such as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS to create an engaging front-end experience.
Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and implement features that enhance user interaction.
Ensure the website is optimized for performance and SEO best practices.
Test and troubleshoot website functionality across various browsers and devices.

Job Types: Fixed Contract

Budget: $2,000.00

title: Webapplication / Webshop with payment thorugh crypto

detail.description:
The website will sell +18 content (images and videos) for payment.
Crypto payments will be implemented using plugins or APIs (e.g., Coinbase Commerce, BitPay).

Security measures:
Protection of sensitive user data through SSL/HTTPS.
Use of secure WordPress plugins to prevent SQL injection and XSS attacks.
Regular updates of themes, plugins, and the WordPress core.

User Features

Registration and Login:
Users can register with a pseudonym/username.
Passwords will be encrypted using WordPress's built-in security features.
Age Verification (18+):
Use a plugin or a simple popup to confirm that users are 18+ without collecting personal data.

Content Access:
Users can browse previews of content (thumbnails, descriptions) and unlock them via payment.

Features for the Client

Content Management:
The client can upload and manage images and videos using WordPress's media library.
Ability to edit content descriptions, set prices, and manage sales through WooCommerce or a similar plugin.

Online Status:
The client can toggle their online/offline status via a custom WordPress dashboard widget.
A visible indicator on the site shows when the client is available for chat.

Chat Functionality:
Real-time chat with users can be implemented using a plugin (e.g., WP Live Chat Support or Tawk.to).
Chat availability depends on the client’s online/offline status.

Technical Requirements

WordPress Core:
Built on the WordPress.org platform with a self-hosted setup.
Customizable through plugins and themes.

Plugins:
WooCommerce for managing payments and sales.
Crypto Payment Gateway Plugins (e.g., Coinbase Commerce, NOWPayments).
Popup Plugin for age verification (e.g., Popup Maker).
Live Chat Plugin for real-time communication.

Media Storage:
Use WordPress’s built-in media library or integrate a third-party cloud storage solution (e.g., AWS S3, Cloudflare R2).

Security Enhancements:
Install security plugins like Wordfence or iThemes Security for additional protection.
Set up automatic backups with a plugin like UpdraftPlus.

Database:
Use the MySQL database included with the hosting service to store user data, sales records, and other site information.

title: Webapplication / Webshop with payment thorugh crypto

detail.description:
The website sells +18 content (images and videos) for payment.
Crypto payments as the only payment method (e.g., Bitcoin, Ethereum).

Security measures:
Protection of sensitive user data.
SSL/HTTPS encryption.
Protection against SQL injection and XSS attacks.

User Features

Registration and Login:
Create a profile with a pseudonym/username.
Password encryption (e.g., bcrypt).
Age Verification (18+):
Popup confirmation for age verification without collecting personal data.

Content Access:
Users can view available content (thumbnails, descriptions) and unlock it after payment.

Features for the Client

Content Management:
Upload images and videos.
Edit descriptions and prices.

Online Status:
Ability to mark herself as "Online" or "Offline."
Users can only send messages when she is "Online."

Chat Functionality:
Real-time communication with users.
Technical Requirements

Backend:
Programmed in Spring Boot (Java) or ASP.NET
User and content management.
Integration of a crypto payment gateway (e.g., Coinbase Commerce, BitPay).

Frontend:
Developed with Angular or anything others also possible
Intuitive, user-friendly design (responsive).

Database:
Storage of users, content, and chat messages.
Use PostgreSQL or MySQL for relational data.
Store media files in a cloud storage solution (e.g., AWS S3).

title: Help Deploying Full-Stack Spring Boot Application on Railway

detail.description:
I’m having trouble deploying a full-stack application built with Spring Boot, MySQL, and React. The backend is being hosted on Railway, while the frontend is hosted on Vercel. The backend crashes during deployment, and I’m encountering errors related to database connectivity and configuration (e.g., Hibernate SessionFactory, JDBC connection issues). I need assistance debugging the deployment process to ensure the backend connects properly to the Railway database and works seamlessly with the frontend hosted on Vercel. 

Should be a simple fix but I'm fairly new to developing and still am learning.

title: Script that pulls list of Groups from Broadcom DX UIM

detail.description:
I have a csv with 2000+ groups.   
Groups have names like XYZ - Substation 6
LOC would be the first 3 characters of the Group name

I need to read groups from CSV and create them in UIM if the don't already exist
The groups are dynamic where startswith = LOC

Looking at UIM SWAGGER UI,

to get groups:

curl -X GET "https://<host>:443/uimapi/groups" -H "accept: application/xml"

to create groups:
curl -X GET "https://<host>:443/uimapi/groups/container?name=<name>&description=<desc>&elementType=system&criteria=<json string>parent=0&account=0" -H "accept: application/xml"

The JSON string could be for example

criteriaOperator = AND" 
isCsfilter = true
subCritera
    attribute = "DisplayName"
    filterOperator = "STARTWITH"
    isCsfilter = true
    negated = false
    value = LOC

Just to see if I can pull the list of what's already in UIM, I tried this but could not get it to work

#Define the UIM API Credentials and URL

$UIMHost = "host"

$Username = "user"

$Password = "password

$UIMAPIURL = “https://$UIMHost:443/uimapi/groups?type=1”

 

# Get Orignal and Set TLS version

$OriginalProtocol = [Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol

[Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = `

[Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls12 , [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls11 , [Net.SecurityProtocolType]::Tls

 

 

#Create the base64-encoded credentials for Basic Authentication

$CredentialBytes = [System.Text.Encoding]::ASCII.GetBytes("$($Username):$($Password)")

$Base64Credential = [Convert]::ToBase64String($CredentialBytes)

 

#Set the headers for the GET request (with the Basic Authentication)

$Headers = @{

    "Accept"           = "application/xml"

    "Accept-Encoding"  = "gzip, deflate, br"

    "Accept-Language"  = "en-US,en;q=0.5"

    "Authorization"    = "Basic $Base64Credential"

    "Host"             = $UIMHosttm

    "Referer"          = https://$UIMHost/uimapi/swagger-ui/index.html

}

 

 

#Ignore Cert Validation

[System.Net.ServicePointManager]::ServerCertificateValidationCallback = {true}

 

#Send the GET request to the UMP

try {

    $response = Invoke-RestMethod -Uri $UIMAPIURL -Method Get -Headers $Headers

    Write-Ouptut "Request Sucessful: $response"

} catch {


    Write-Error "Request Failed. Error details:"

    Write-Error $_.Exception.Message

}

 

# Restore original protocol

[Net.ServicePointManager]::SecurityProtocol = $OriginalProtocol

Idealy< I would like a script to pull the Network Containers under Universe in Broadcom DX Spectrum and create the same groups in Broadcom DX UIM

title: "I'm seeking guidance on GitHub Python Backend Engineering projects to enhance my portfolio and job prospects post-graduation.

detail.description:
I have a solid foundation in the basics of software development, including OOP, Git, Python, Java, and Haskell. However, I struggle to transition from academic or incomplete projects to industry-standard software engineering projects.

Currently, all my GitHub repositories are private, as they are either related to university assignments or lack the polish to be published publicly.

I am seeking a mentor to guide me through the following steps:

Identifying a project that aligns with my skills and helps me grow professionally.
Navigating the process of contributing to this project effectively.
Showcasing my skills and progress by reflecting on this project in a personal portfolio.
I would greatly appreciate this guidance, particularly for my first public project, to help me establish a professional presence in software development.

title: Expert Trainer in Azure Cloud Development, Terraform, and Project Building

detail.description:
I am actively seeking a skilled and experienced trainer to help me upskill in Azure Cloud Development and effectively integrate Terraform with Azure for infrastructure automation. Additionally, I am looking for someone who can guide me in building real-world projects to solidify my learning and gain practical experience.

This will be a long-term training commitment, focusing on mastering every aspect of Azure Development, including advanced concepts, best practices, and hands-on implementation.

Here are some key details about my current status and requirements:

I have recently completed the Azure Fundamentals certification, so I am familiar with the basics of Azure.
My goal is to become a proficient Cloud Developer with deep knowledge of Azure services and tools.
I want to gain expertise in using Terraform for managing Azure infrastructure.
The training should include practical guidance on building projects that simulate real-world scenarios.
A mix of theoretical knowledge and hands-on experience is essential.
If you are a trainer with proven experience in Azure Development, Terraform, and mentoring on project building, and are passionate about teaching, I would love to connect with you!

Please feel free to reach out to me with your experience, training plan, and rates.

title: URGENT - IMMEDIATE HIRE - OpenAPI 3.1 Specification Expert Needed to Resolve API Schema Issues

detail.description:
I am looking for an experienced OpenAPI specification expert who can help troubleshoot and resolve issues in our API schema. Our current schema, generated using FastAPI, is facing validation errors in Swagger Editor and compatibility challenges when used with GPT-powered applications.

This is an ongoing issue, and we need someone with deep expertise in OpenAPI 3.0/3.1, API documentation, and FastAPI to assist in fixing these problems efficiently.

Responsibilities:

Review our OpenAPI schema and identify root causes of validation errors.
Guide us in fixing structural issues, such as:
OpenAPI version mismatches.
Invalid schema definitions (anyOf, nullable, etc.).
Security scheme issues.
Parameter and response type mismatches.
Help optimize the schema for compatibility with Swagger Editor and GPT-powered tools.
Work collaboratively via screen-sharing to ensure solutions are implemented effectively.
Provide clear explanations and documentation for changes made.
